sentence.text: That did the trick .
That did the trick , did n't it just !
And apparently they believed it , as it did the trick .
His voice was low , for her alone , but it did the trick .
This classy poetry appeared to do the trick .
Calling out his name is enough to do the trick .
The party is hoping that , this time , the $26 billion bribe is big enough to do the trick .
If the sugar-free diet does not do the trick , the next step is to cut out all fruit for a while .
But I 'd very surprised if that does n't do the trick .
Many of the cars being repaired have been converted to accept unleaded according to manufacturers guidelines which suggest a quick correction of engine timing will do the trick .

The free Trade Agreement will do the trick â€¦ a situation in which the old-fashioned Unionist intransigence which served Britain so well in the past will also be outdated as no longer so convenient to imperialism .
Indeed , he even had a buccaneering moment when it seemed to him that to have a choc-bar himself would do the trick of making him exactly like her .
` Come on ! " she urged , and the desperation in her voice almost did the trick .
Should you have any difficulty , a word with your Club rep will normally do the trick .
It usually does the trick with anyone who loves their job .
It looked as if the Saunders -Atkinson partnership had done the trick for Villa again in the 77th minute .
` Becoming better at what we do and widening the gap between selling price and manufacturing cost is the only target that will do the trick for us , " he declared .
As Bon Jovi jetted out , the faithful made their way home , unanimous that a dose of Bad Medicine had done the trick for them .
If company cars , company fitted-kitchens or company hi-fi seem to do the trick , sad but fine .
The room smelt horribly of burnt rubber , but it had done the trick .
Perhaps silver bullets would have done the trick .
Air and water brought alternately into contact with earth did the trick .
